p: In 1992, Dr. Warren Winkelstein Jr., a celebrated epidemiologist at the University of California, wrote about the works of another highly decorated physician epidemiologist, Sir Richard Doll [ 5, 6]. Professor Winkelstein categorized the work of Sir Doll into three major determinants of worldwide health: (1) Population, (2) Poverty and, (3) Pollution. These “3 Ps” are even more relevant today and should be used to examine the COVID-19 pandemic and to prevent future epidemics and pandemics [ 5, 6, 7].
